explanation: The report is correct. The initial memcpy(xbuf, pp->xbuf, pp->xbuf_pos) can read beyond the bounds of pp->xbuf because the code only uses mhd_assert to check pp->xbuf_pos against sizeof(xbuf). An assert is not a guaranteed runtime check (it may be compiled out) and the check compares against sizeof(xbuf), not sizeof(pp->xbuf). There is no guaranteed, performed check that pp->xbuf_pos <= sizeof(pp->xbuf) before the memcpy, so a corrupted or unexpectedly large pp->xbuf_pos (or a pp->xbuf that is smaller than xbuf) could cause an out-of-bounds read of the source buffer. That situation violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17. To fix it, perform a real runtime bounds check (for example if (pp->xbuf_pos <= sizeof(pp->xbuf)) memcpy(...); or limit the length passed to memcpy to the smaller of the two sizes), or otherwise ensure by provable means (e.g. compile-time sizing guarantees) that pp->xbuf is at least as large as the amount copied.
